alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 1:24PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL FRANKLIN COUNTY THROUGH 200 PM EDT... At 124 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chambersburg, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... St. Thomas, Fort Loudon, Upper Strasburg, Roxbury, Willow Hill, Fannettsburg and Orrstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for south central and central Pennsylvania.
